definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels

sentences.english: A September sunrise greets Mount Colden's summit.
sentences.chinese: 九月日出与冷山山峰交汇。

sentences.english: The peak is enveloped in clouds.
So, it is a mountain that we are both climbing.
sentences.chinese: 因此这是一座我们俩都在攀越的山峰。

sentences.english: The building extends from the mountain foot to the mountain top and almost covers the whole peak.
sentences.chinese: 建筑从山下直到山顶几乎占了整座山峰。

sentences.english: East of the boundary, mountain peaks on Kuh-i-Rahmat cast dark shadows to the north.
sentences.chinese: 在边界东边，拉赫马特山山峰在北侧投下阴影。

sentences.english: They saw the lofty peak in all its majesty.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到了高耸的山峰，气势雄伟壮丽。

sentences.english: Japan's Mount Fuji, covered with snow, stands amidst the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 日本富士山，山峰高耸入云，山巅白雪皑皑。

sentences.english: Heavenly Capital, you know, is the most precipitous peak of Mount Huangshan.
sentences.chinese: 天都峰是黄山最陡峭的山峰。

sentences.english: Africa was noted to have the world's highest mountain and longest river.
sentences.chinese: 非洲被标注着拥有世界上最高的山峰和最长的河流。

sentences.english: I feel as miserable as a mountain in the winter breeze.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己像冬日寒风中的山峰悲伤的伫立。

sentences.english: The steamer passed by steep hills and was close to the destination.
sentences.chinese: 轮船经过了陡峭的山峰并靠近目的地。

sentences.english: With living hues and odors plain and hill
sentences.chinese: 将色和香充满了山峰和平原。

sentences.english: G. Montgomerie, was quietly busy in surveying the mountains of Kashmir.
sentences.chinese: 蒙特哥摩利正悄悄忙于勘察克什米尔境内的山峰。

sentences.english: The pictograph for a mountain was originally three peaks together.
sentences.chinese: 山的象形字原来是三座山峰堆在一起的。

sentences.english: The northern flank of the mountain collapsed, producing the largest landslide in recorded history.
sentences.chinese: 山峰的北坡坍塌了，这是美国史上最大规模的山崩。

definition: halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
the peaks of a mountain range
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
